assignments.title: Case Study Analysis Paper: Columbia & Tenerife
assignments.description: Prepare a report that summarizes the events leading up to the Columbia and Tenerife disasters, with a brief compare-and-contrast analysis.

assignments.title: Presentations on Assigned Readings
assignments.description: Prepare a brief power point presentation (5 – 7 slides max.) to be presented to and distributed to the rest of the class.

assignments.title: Decision Forum Presentation
assignments.description: Work in small teams to identify, address, and improve a major decision that is upcoming or was faced in the past.

assignments.title: Individual Reflection: YOUR Decision-Making
assignments.description: Consider your past decisions, approaches and practices along with the materials presented throughout the semester.

additional_info.course_format: This course spans thirteen weeks with a different learning module covered each week.
additional_info.technology_requirements: Basic computer and web-browsing skills, navigating Canvas, live web conferencing using Zoom, recording a slide presentation with audio narration.
additional_info.support_resources: Office of Counseling and Psychological Services (CAPS) offers free and confidential services to all enrolled students.

_metadata.course_description: The objective of this course is to help students understand how decisions are made, why they are often less than optimal, and how decision-making can be improved.
learning_outcomes: Evaluate past decisions and explore why decision-making can be challenging
Assess decision-making from a psychological, statistical, and rational model perspective
Analyze the limits of rational thinking – biases, emotions, and uncertainty and how to overcome them
Apply strategies to enable better decision making
